'''Indor''' was the father of [[Peleg]] and a grandfather of [[Tuor]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref>{{LT2|III}}, p. 160</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Indor'' is in [[Gnomish]], most likely being the word ''indor'' ("master of house, lord") used as a personal name.<ref>{{LT2|Appendix}}, entry '''Indor''', p. 343</ref> Its [[Qenya]] cognate is also ''Indor''.<ref>{{PE|13}}, "[[Official Name List]]", p. 103</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In the later legendarium, according to ''[[The Children of Húrin]]'', '''[[Indor]]''' was the name of [[Aerin]]'s father.<ref>{{CH|12}}, p. 189</ref>
